data.title: Chinese University of Hong Kong
data.meta_description: The Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK) is a public research university in Sha Tin, New Territories, Hong Kong. Established in 1963 as a federation of three colleges – Chung Chi College, New Asia College, and United College, it is Hong Kong's second-oldest university.
data.text:
The Chinese University of Hong Kong[lower-alpha 2] (CUHK) is a public research university in Sha Tin, New Territories, Hong Kong. Established in 1963 as a federation of three colleges – Chung Chi College, New Asia College, and United College,[5] it is Hong Kong's second-oldest university.

"CUHK" redirects here. Not to be confused with City University of Hong Kong.

Quick Facts Motto, Motto in English ...

Close

CUHK is now organised into nine constituent colleges and eight academic faculties, and remains the only collegiate university in Hong Kong. The university operates in both English and Chinese, though classes are taught in English.
